Questions and Answers [sn12.32:18.1]: The Buddha asks Sāriputta if he has declared enlightenment
Sāriputta clarifies that he did not state the matter in those exact words
The Buddha affirms that no matter how a gentleman declares enlightenment, it should be regarded as such
The Buddha asks Sāriputta a series of questions about the source of rebirth, continued existence, grasping, and craving
Sāriputta answers each question in turn
The Buddha praises Sāriputta's answers and summarizes the teachings on suffering and release
Sāriputta's ability to answer questions: Sāriputta states that he could answer the Buddha's questions in different words and ways for seven days and nights
Kaḷāra the Aristocrat tells the Buddha that Sāriputta has comprehended the principle of the teachings and could answer any questions in different words and ways up to the seventh day and night.
